#Text=Tada Falls
#Text=Tada Falls , or Ubbalamdugu Falls , is in Tada mandal of Nellore district in India .
#Text=It is on the border of Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh .
#Text=It is around 95 km from Chennai .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Tada is well connected to Chennai via local trains and mofussil buses that head to Chennai from Tirupathi and Nellore .
#Text=By train
#Text=Trains from Chennai heading to Sullurpeta from Chennai Central pass via Tada .
#Text=There is a train every two hours and the last train from Tada to Chennai leaves at 8:30PM .
#Text=By car
#Text=To reach Tada , cross the Padi junction in Chennai and take the Redhills route and join NH-5 .
#Text=Drive for about 60 km and you will reach Tada town .
#Text=Before you reach Tada you will cross the AP checkpost .
#Text=If you are taking taxis , then you will have to shell out permit tax here ( ₹250 for Indica and Ambassador ) and it is pretty high for a Tata Sumo or Tempo Traveller .
#Text=It might be cost effective to take 2 Indica 's compared to a Tata Sumo .
#Text=Once you reach Tada , take the left which is right next to the bridge and you will reach Varadiah Palem .
#Text=Ask the people for directions from here .
#Text=You have to take a left turn to reach Tada falls and there are absolutely no indications at this point .
#Text=You can reach this place from Kalahasti too .
#Text=Get around
#Text=It is 20 km from the Tada to reach the base camp of the Tada falls .
#Text=Where you can park our vehicles and start trekking .
#Text=The only way to get around from here is on foot .
#Text=Locally the falls is called " Ubbalamadugu Falls " .
#Text=Remember this name as it can come in handy if you are lost .
#Text=Do
#Text=The ideal time to visit Tada is between August-December when the sun is a little less intense .
#Text=The worst time is March-June .
#Text=Once you have reached Base Camp the trek begins .
#Text=The total trek distance would be about 10 km to and fro with nearly 4 km in really rocky conditions .
#Text=From here , the mud road begins and if you are on SUV or two wheelers , you can go for another 1 km .
#Text=Just after 150 m or so , you reached a place where you must cross a a small stream .
#Text=A small word of caution : do n't get into it with your shoes on .
#Text=It will become really tough to trek with wet soles .
#Text=Once you cross this small stream the walk continues till you reach a mud-path .
#Text=Follow this mud-path and you will first go up the hill and then down the hill .
#Text=It is quite tricky to follow the path as in some places only rocks are seen and there is absolutely nothing to indicate a path .
#Text=Keep walking along the mud-path and you will cross another stream .
#Text=Continue walking on the mud-path and around 30 min later you will reach a Siva Temple .
#Text=This is the last place where you can sit comfortably and have food , if you have n't had any so far .
#Text=If you do n't reach the Siva temple within an hour and half of starting the trek , then you have lost your way .
#Text=Use the time-tested method of following the stream and proceed .
#Text=After this point there is no proper path and you have to rely on the direction shown people who are around the Siva Temple .
#Text=You have to cross the stream and then look for a path .
#Text=You will find a small clearing and this might help you on the way forward .
#Text=From here on , the trek starts to become difficult .
#Text=You encounter rocks and millipedes on those rocks on the way forward .
#Text=( Remember to listen for the stream from this point on .
#Text=This would be very helpful . )
#Text=Some of the rocks are pretty big .
#Text=You have to climb nearly 3 m at times and some of the formations are also difficult .
#Text=There should be two falls , but only one is found during peak summer before the rains have started .
#Text=Cost
#Text=Total cost per person ( approx ) : ₹450 ( includes travelling , lunch , breakfast ) .
#Text=See
#Text=Chengalamma Temple is in Sullurpeta .
#Text=The temple do n't have any doors .
#Text=Pulicat Lake is the second largest brackish – water lake or lagoon in India
#Text=Eat
#Text=Commercialization of this place has n't begun :
#Text=it is still a nice spot for trekking without the usual buzz of people and shops surrounding you .
#Text=There are small cantees and grocery stores at Tada , where you can buy snacks or water .
#Text=Drink
#Text=You can buy water at Tada and do not forget to fill you bottles from the Stream before making the return journey .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=With limited accommodation available nearby , the nearest place is Sullurpeta , which has very good AC and Non-AC lodges .
#Text=Staying in the forest beyond sunset is not advised .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Keep around 2½ hr for the journey back .
#Text=It will be tiring , so give yourself ample time and also take rest wherever needed .
#Text=Drinking water becomes a luxury and so you can fill the bottles from the streams .
#Text=This trek is n't for someone who does n't enjoy walking on the rocks .
#Text=You can take the same way back to reach Tada village from the Tada Falls .
#Text=There on you can either take a bus , train or cab back to Chennai or Tirupati .
